trid.file_type: file seems to be plain text/ASCII

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the execution of a Windows system binary that is usually located in the system folder from an uncommon location.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Patrick Bareiss, Anton Kutepov, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: New RUN Key Pointing to Suspicious Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious new RUN key element pointing to an executable in a suspicious folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Markus Neis, Sander Wiebing, Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects when a file with a suspicious extension is created in the startup folder
Detects a file ending in jse, vbe, js, vba, vbs written by cscript.exe or wscript.exe

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Script Interpreter Execution From Suspicious Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a suspicious script execution in temporary folders or folders accessible by environment variables
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Script Execution From Temp Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a suspicious script executions from temporary folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Max Altgelt (Nextron Systems), Tim Shelton

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Schedule Task Creation From Env Variable Or Potentially Suspicious Path Via Schtasks.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects Schtask creations that point to a suspicious folder or an environment variable often used by malware

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32\; OriginalFileName=schtasks.exe; Hashes=SHA1=85E046DE3C2DE1B4C85E57BA00CF7151B3D59F24,MD5=D857FA7279E2861199583474C17A1C6C,SHA256=DDDE64F0F55751763C1BCD53DE9CDFFC0D725D45A8476464A2A0422661813004,IMPHASH=44E70F20C235C150D75F6FC8B1E29CD1; Description=Task Scheduler Configuration Tool; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=cmd /c schtasks /create /sc minute /mo 30 /tn Skype /tr "C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming\PHat.jar"; CommandLine=schtasks  /create /sc minute /mo 30 /tn Skype /tr "C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming\PHat.jar"; FileVersion=10.0.22621.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=Medium; Image=C:\Windows\System32\schtasks.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects shell spawned from Java host process, which could be a sign of exploitation (e.g. log4j exploitation)

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=13E9BB7E85FF9B08C26A440412E5CD5D296C4D35,MD5=5A6BE4D2519515241D0C133A26CF62C0,SHA256=423E0E810A69AACEBA0E5670E58AFF898CF0EBFFAB99CCB46EBB3464C3D2FACB,IMPHASH=D73E39DAB3C8B57AA408073D01254964; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=Cmd.Exe; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows Command Processor; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.8.0_441\bin\java.exe" -jar "C:\Users\Bruno\PHat.jar"; CommandLine=cmd /c schtasks /create /sc minute /mo 30 /tn Skype /tr "C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming\PHat.jar"; FileVersion=10.0.22621.1635 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.8.0_441\bin\java.exe; IntegrityLevel=Medium; Image=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential Dropper Script Execution Via WScript/CScript
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects wscript/cscript executions of scripts located in user directories
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Margaritis Dimitrios (idea), Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Use Short Name Path in Command Line
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detect use of the Windows 8.3 short name. Which could be used as a method to avoid command-line detection

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: ADS Zone.Identifier Deleted By Uncommon Application
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the deletion of the "Zone.Identifier" ADS by an uncommon process. Attackers can leverage this in order to bypass security restrictions that make use of the ADS such as Microsoft Office apps.
A General detection for files being created in the Windows startup directory. This could be an indicator of persistence.
Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation of scheduled tasks by user accounts via the "schtasks" utility.

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=85E046DE3C2DE1B4C85E57BA00CF7151B3D59F24,MD5=D857FA7279E2861199583474C17A1C6C,SHA256=DDDE64F0F55751763C1BCD53DE9CDFFC0D725D45A8476464A2A0422661813004,IMPHASH=44E70F20C235C150D75F6FC8B1E29CD1; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32\; OriginalFileName=schtasks.exe; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Task Scheduler Configuration Tool; FileVersion=10.0.22621.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine=cmd /c schtasks /create /sc minute /mo 30 /tn Skype /tr "C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming\PHat.jar"; CommandLine=schtasks  /create /sc minute /mo 30 /tn Skype /tr "C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming\PHat.jar"; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=Medium; Image=C:\Windows\System32\schtasks.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects an executable that has been encoded with base64 twice
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET DNS Query to a *.pw domain - Likely Hostile
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert dns $HOME_NET any -> any any (msg:"ET DNS Query to a *.pw domain - Likely Hostile"; dns.query; content:".pw"; nocase; endswith; content:!".u.pw"; endswith; nocase; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2016778; rev:8; metadata:created_at 2013_04_20, confidence Medium, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2020_11_19, reviewed_at 2024_04_22;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO DYNAMIC_DNS Query to *.duckdns. Domain
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert dns $HOME_NET any -> any any (msg:"ET INFO DYNAMIC_DNS Query to *.duckdns. Domain"; dns.query; content:".duckdns."; nocase; classtype:misc-activity; sid:2022918; rev:4; metadata:created_at 2016_06_27, confidence Medium, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2022_11_30, reviewed_at 2024_04_16;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO DYNAMIC_DNS Query to a *.duckdns .org Domain
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert dns $HOME_NET any -> any any (msg:"ET INFO DYNAMIC_DNS Query to a *.duckdns .org Domain"; dns.query; content:".duckdns.org"; fast_pattern; nocase; endswith; reference:url,changeip.com; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2042936; rev:2; metadata:attack_target Client_and_Server, created_at 2022_12_15, deployment Perimeter, performance_impact Low, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2023_03_02, mitre_tactic_id TA0011, mitre_tactic_name Command_And_Control, mitre_technique_id T1568, mitre_technique_name Dynamic_Resolution;)

attributes.magic: ASCII text, with very long lines (64424u), with CRLF line terminators

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.
